butterfly1.description: Nana gave Felix a "Butterfly Garden". We've been watching five caterpillars grow and make their cocoons for the last five weeks. The butterflies emerged a few days ago. We've been waiting for a warm sunny day to release them. It took them about half an hour to figure out how to fly.
butterfly1.title: Butterfly 1

butterfly2.description: We've had 6 weeks of rain.  The refrain everyone's saying is, "We might as well be living in Seattle!"  We made the most of the one sunny day last week.
butterfly2.title: Butterfly 2

couchjumping1.description: Kora and Torin came for a sleepover.  The excitement level was, well, up there.
couchjumping1.title: Couchjumping 1

couchjumping3.description: Kora, age 6, is Felix's sweetheart. She leaves "I love you Felix" notes in his cubby at school.
couchjumping3.title: Couchjumping 3

couchjumping4.description: They jumped from couch to armchair to beanbag, round and about again, to loud music, longer than we thought humanly possible.
couchjumping4.title: Couchjumping 4

easter2.description: Easter morning.  Everybody found good loot, including Milo.
easter2.title: Easter 2

easter3.description: Score! By the way, that pirate ship? We traded a train set to a shoolmate for it. It floats.
easter3.title: Easter 3

easter4.description: Did you know that the Easter Bunny puts geodes in some eggs? Geodes are rocks with crystal formations inside of them.
easter4.title: Easter 4

easter5.description: Chowing down on the real eggs.
easter5.title: Easter 5

easter6.description: Milo prefers hard boiled egg to chocolate bunny.  Really.
easter6.title: Easter 6

hazel1.description: Jen and Hazel dropped by.  Hazel is four months younger than Milo.
hazel1.title: Hazel 1

hazel2.description: Hazel thoughtfully observe during her entire visit.
hazel2.title: Hazel 2

hazel3.description: Milo, in a very rare moment of food jealousy.
hazel3.title: Hazel 3

hurt_sign.description: This is Milo's baby sign for 'hurt'.  He likes to make the crocodile bite other stuffed animals, upon which he'll say "sorry!" and kiss their boo-boos.
hurt_sign.title: Hurt Sign

joyces1.description: Father and son (and Jeremey Jacob) bond over a fart joke.
joyces1.title: Joyces 1

joyces2.description: It was really funny. No? Well, maybe you had to be there.
joyces2.title: Joyces 2

joyces3.description: At the Joyces for Easter supper.  Felix still worships Keenan, and Milo's developing a thing for Bucket the cat.
joyces3.title: Joyces 3

lemonade1.description:
We took a few hours break in the weather to set up a lemonade stand.

Our primary goal was to sell tickets to the New School Raffle, which is taking place in 2 weeks. Alas, we only sold 2... we are still 58 short of our quota! Do you want one? Drop Lucie an email if you do. They are $1 per ticket, ot $6 for 5 tickets. Prices include gift certifcates for local stores and more.
lemonade1.title: Lemonade 1

lemonade2.description: We placed it strategically at the gates of the local playground, and soon discovered the first law of retail:  always have lots and lots of change on hand.
lemonade2.title: Lemonade 2

mimi1.description: If you haven't already met him, this is Jacob Jeremy.  Milo calls him 'Mimi'.  He's Milo's sleep aid, confidante and general all-round comfort friend.
mimi1.title: Mimi 1

mimi2.description: If Milo needs a partner for playing cars, cooking, or the odd fart joke, Mimi always gets the job.
mimi2.title: Mimi 2

mimi3.description: And Mimi's always up for a pretend poop.
mimi3.title: Mimi 3

pillowfight1.description: Milo's gotten much more stong and active in the last month, to the point where pillowfights are an option.
pillowfight1.title: Pillowfight 1

pillowfight2.description: It's lopsided -- Felix pretty much just wails on Milo -- but Milo loves that he's playing a game, any game, with his big brother.
pillowfight2.title: Pillowfight 2

teatime.description: Milo enjoys a contemplative cup of decaf tea.
teatime.title: Teatime

description:
Happy Easter! A certain fluffy bunny visited our house and left eggs. Felix dressed in his finest pink.

Last week we said that Milo was entering an age of spectacular tanturms. Now we're thinking it was just jet lag, because he didn't have a single outburst this week. His latest thing is to say "Milo" (not "mine") when it's his toy or his turn to do something. But still remarkably unpossesive, especially compared to other kids his age.
title: April 16
